title._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/span-sa: Compile time safety for ref-like types
title._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/indexin: Indexing fixed fields without pinning regardless of context
title._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/using.m: Pattern based using and using declarations

description._csharplang/spec/introduction.md: This introduction provides an overview of the C# language and its design goals. Note: This chapter has been removed from the official standard in version 5.
description._csharplang/spec/lexical-structure.md: This chapter explains the lexical grammar, and the syntactic grammar of the C# language.
description._csharplang/spec/basic-concepts.md: This chapter introduces the major building blocks of any C# program. Concepts such as assemblies, program start and completion, member access, garbage completion and execution order are defined.
description._csharplang/spec/types.md: This chapter defines value types, reference types, generic types and other program entities. Concepts such as assemblies, namespaces, classes, interfaces and structs are defined.
description._csharplang/spec/variables.md: This chapter covers variable categories, default values, definite assignment, and variable references.
description._csharplang/spec/conversions.md: This chapter covers the possible conversions from one type to another in C#. Builtin conversions, user defined conversions, implicit and explicit conversions are defined.
description._csharplang/spec/expressions.md: This chapter covers operators and expressions. Expressions form several groups, including primary expressions, unary operators, arithmetic operators, relational and type testing operators, and logical operators.
description._csharplang/spec/statements.md: This chapter covers statements in C#. Each statement is defined, as are statement blocks, statement reachability, and end points.
description._csharplang/spec/namespaces.md: This chapter defines namespaces, including how to declare them and how to use them.
description._csharplang/spec/classes.md: This chapter covers class declarations, including all member types that can be included in classes. This includes generic classes as well as non-generic classes.
description._csharplang/spec/structs.md: This chapter defines struct declarations. In many cases, the descriptions are defined using the differences between classes and structs.
description._csharplang/spec/arrays.md: This chapter defines arrays. It includes the rules for array variance, multi-dimensional arrays and jagged arrays.
description._csharplang/spec/interfaces.md: This chapter defines interfaces. This includes interface declarations, implementing interfaces, and explicit interface implementation.
description._csharplang/spec/enums.md: This chapter defines the enum types in C#. Enums create a set of named constants and are represented by an underlying integral set of values.
description._csharplang/spec/delegates.md: This chapter defines delegates, which are objects that hold type safe function pointers.
description._csharplang/spec/exceptions.md: This chapter defines exceptions. Exceptions are how errors are reported by C# programs. This chapter covers throwing exceptions, catching exceptions, and resource cleanup when exceptions are thrown.
description._csharplang/spec/attributes.md: This chapter covers attributes. Attributes are metadata types that can be applied to many program elements: classes, structs, assemblies, members, and arguments.
description._csharplang/spec/unsafe-code.md: This chapter describes elements of C# that are allowed in unsafe code blocks. These elements include pointers, fixed buffers and dynamic memory allocation.
This appendix describes XML comments that are used to document your program.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/pattern: This feature specification describes the pattern matching featues added in C# 7.0. Note that future releases built on this initial set of features.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/local-f: This feature specification describes local functions, which are functions that are embedded in another method or function.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/out-var: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements that enable declaring 'out' variables in the expression where they are used.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/throw-e: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements that allow 'throw' to be either an expression or a statement.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/binary-: This feature specification describes the syntax to declare binary literals for integral constants.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/digit-s: This feature specification describes the syntax to allow separators between groups of digits in numeric literals.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.0/task-ty: This feature specification describes the syntax to support async return types that match a pattern, rather than restricting them to Task.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.1/async-m: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements to declare a Main method that is async and returns a Task type.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.1/target-: This feature specification describes the syntax to use the default keyword where the type of the expression can be inferred by the compiler.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.1/infer-t: This feature specification describes how the compiler interprets and infers the members names in a tuple.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.1/generic: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements to enable pattern matching with generic types.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/readonl: This feature specification describes how to create readonly references to variables. This includes the 'readonly' modifier on variables, and the 'in' modifier on parameters and arguments.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/span-sa: This feature specification describes the rules that govern 'ref struct' declarations and their use.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/non-tra: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements that enable named arguments followed by positional arguments in a method call.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/private: This feature specification describes the 'private protected' access modifier.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/conditi: This feature specification describes the syntax enhancements for using 'ref' with '?:' expressions
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.2/leading: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements to support a leading digit separator in numeric literals.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/blittab: This feature specification describes the 'unmanaged' generic type constraint. That forces the type argument to be an unmanaged type.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/indexin: This feature specification describes syntax enhancement to support indexing fixed fields without pinning the memory, regardless of context.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/pattern: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements to enable more types to be the target of a fixed statement.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/ref-loc: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements that enable ref local variables to be assigned to refer to different storage after being initialized.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/stackal: This feature specification describes the syntax that enables arrays to be declared using the 'stackalloc' keyword.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/auto-pr: This feature specification describes syntax enhancements to declare attributes that target either the property or the field in an auto-implemented property declaration.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/express: This feature specification enables declarations of 'out' variables in more locations.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/tuple-e: This feature specification describes the rules governing tuple equality (==) and inequality (!=).
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-7.3/improve: This feature specification describes updates to improve overload candidates for overload resolution.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/nullabl: This feature specification describes nullable reference types.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/pattern: This feature specification describes recursive pattern matching, where patterns can nest inside other patterns.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/default: This feature specification describe the syntax updates necessary to support default interface methods. This includes declaring bodies in interface declarations, and supporting modifiers on declarations.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/async-s: This feature specification describes async streams, which return streams of data asynchronously, typically as each element is produced or available.
This feature specification describes the syntax for ranges and indices, which support indexing individual elements of a sequence or a range of a sequence from the start or end of that sequence.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/using.m: This feature specification supports pattern based using and using declarations to simplify resource cleanup.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/null-co: This feature specification describes the syntax to support null coalescing assignment expressions using the '??=' operator.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/readonl: This feature specification describes the syntax for declaring and using readonly instance members.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/static-: This feature specification describes static local functions, which are local functions that cannot access variables in the enclosing scope.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-8.0/nested-: This feature specification describes nested stackalloc expressions, which provides nested arrays of stackalloc storage.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/covaria: This feature specification describes covariant return types, where overriding member declarations can return a type derived from the overridden member declaration.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/extendi: This feature specification describes extensions to partial methods. These extensions enable source generators to create or call partial methods.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/extensi: This feature specification describes the necessary pattern for an extension method to provide the GetEnumerator support in a foreach loop.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/functio: This feature specification describes function pointers, which are unmanaged delegates. They are typically used to avoid the allocations necessary to instantiate a delegate object.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/init.md: This feature specification describes the rules for 'init' only setters in properties. These can be set only as part of an instantiation, using property initializer syntax.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/lambda-: This feature specification describes the new language rules that enable the '_' to be a discard parameter in a lambda expression.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/local-f: This feature specification describes rules to apply attributes on local functions.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/module-: This feature specification describes how to declare module initializers, which are methods called by the runtime when a module, or assembly, is loaded.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/native-: This feature specification describes native sized integers, which are integer types that use the processor's natural integral types.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/nullabl: This feature specification provides a more complete specification for nullable reference types.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/pattern: This feature specification describes the additional pattern matching syntax added in C# 9.0. This includes relational patterns, 'and' and 'or' patterns, negated patterns and parenthesized patterns.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/records: This feature specification describes records. Records are reference types that provide value based equality semantics.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/skip-lo: This feature specification describes a performance enhancement to suppress emitting localsinit flag. This will prevent the runtime from initializing memory to 0 as part of allocating it.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/static-: This feature specification describes static anonymous functions. Static anonymous functions are lambda expressions that are prohibited from accessing variables in the enclosing scope. That prevents them from creating a closure.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/target-: This feature specification describes syntax rules to find a best match for the target of a conditional expression (?:).
This feature specification describes the enhancements to 'new' where the target type can be inferred from the variable declaration.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/top-lev: This feature specification describes top-level statements, which are program statements that replace the typical 'Main' method enclosed in a startup class.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-9.0/unconst: This feature specification unconstrained type parameter annotations. This enables 'T?' to be used where 'T' is not constrained to be either a value type or a reference type.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/record: This feature specification describes record structs, which are structs where the compiler generates methods similar to those for record classes.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/parame: This feature specification parameterless struct constructors, which can now be declared for structs. The rules for when they are called describe behavior in arrays and other variable declarations.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/Global: This feature specification describes global using directives, which add a using directive to every file compiled as part of an assembly.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/file-s: This feature specification describes file scoped namespaces, where the entire contents of a file are included in a namespace declared at the top of the file, without braces to define its scope.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/extend: This feature specification describes extended property patterns. These enable more convenient syntax to pattern match on properties nested in objects contained in an object.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/improv: This feature specification describes performance improvements to interpolated strings for many scenarios. These enhancements enable to the compiler to lazily evaluate the expressions used in the interpolated string, possibly avoiding evaluation.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/consta: This feature specification describes constant interpolated strings, where you can use the '$' token to compose a constant string from other constants.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/lambda: This feature specification describes a number of syntax improves that making declaring lambda expressions more convenient in a variety of different contexts.
This feature specification describes the syntax enhancements to declare attributes on lambda expressions.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/caller: This feature specification describes attributes that can be used to enable the compiler to convert a caller argument expression into text. This is primarily used for debugging and testing scenarios.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/enhanc: This feature specification describes updates to the #line directive. These enhancements support scenarios like Razor where the Razor engine wants more control over the line number so that it maps to your source rather than the generated file.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/generi: This feature specification describes generic attributes, where a generic class may derive from 'System.Attribute'.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/improv: This feature specification describes updates to the rules for definite assignment analysis. The result is more accurate warnings for when a variable may not be definitely assigned, or may not be null.
description._csharplang/proposals/csharp-10.0/async-: This feature specification describes new rules to enable types to override the default AsyncMethodBuilder. This will be used by the runtime for performance improvements.
description._vblang/spec/introduction.md: This chapter provides and introduction to the Visual Basic language.
description._vblang/spec/lexical-grammar.md: This chapter defines the lexical grammar for Visual Basic.
description._vblang/spec/preprocessing-directives.md: This chapter defines the preprocessing directives allowed in Visual Basic
description._vblang/spec/general-concepts.md: This chapter describes the general concepts used in the Visual Basic language.
description._vblang/spec/attributes.md: This chapter describes attributes. Attributes are metadata types that can be applied to many elements in your program.
description._vblang/spec/source-files-and-namespaces: This chapter describes how you can organize your code in multiple folders, source files, and namespaces.
description._vblang/spec/types.md: This chapter defines value types, reference types, generic types and other program entities in Visual Basic. Concepts such as assemblies, namespaces, classes, interfaces and structs are defined.
description._vblang/spec/conversions.md: This chapter covers the possible conversions from one type to another in Visual Basic. Builtin conversions, user defined conversions, implicit and explicit conversions are defined.
description._vblang/spec/type-members.md: This chapter defines members of types. Members include methods, properties, fields, delegates, and events.
description._vblang/spec/statements.md: This chapter covers statements in Visual Basic. Each statement is defined, as are how to group statements, and the execution order of statements.
description._vblang/spec/expressions.md: This chapter covers operators and expressions. Expressions include unary operators, arithmetic operators, relational and type testing operators, and logical operators.
description._vblang/spec/documentation-comments.md: This chapter describes XML comments that are used to document your program.
description._vblang/spec/overload-resolution.md: This chapter describes the rules that govern overload resolution when multiple members have the same name.
